page.title: 13VISITORS TO THE NEWQUAY AREA
page.content: The{tourist trade}is very important to the area. Tourists stay in hotels, self catering flats and campsites. The Pentire headland has a large number of hotels, flats and guest houses. West Pentire has a smaller number. There are 3 campsites in the Crantock area, a large caravan park and over 3000 people can stay on Pentire each week in the summer. Most of the hotels close from October to April. We looked at an hotel, a caravan and camp site. {The Bay Hotel} was established in 1908 when it was just 2 joined houses and was the only hotel in Pentire. Two-thirds of the visitors come by coach. {Beacon Park} is for caravans. Each caravan is really a small, temporary home which is fully equipped and very comfort- able. The{Camp Site}is mainly for the use of people with canvas tents.
